definition: to be evident at a glance (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: You can see with half an eye that there is a difference between a politician and a statesman.
sentences.chinese: 你可一望而知，政客与政治家是有不同之处。

sentences.english: Evidently Biddy had taught Joe to write.
sentences.chinese: 一望而知，毕蒂已经教会了乔写字。

sentences.english: She was beautiful with that unmistakable beauty that only artists delight in .
sentences.chinese: 她的美是一望而知的，只有艺术家才会倾倒的。

definition: to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
variant of 氣宇軒昂|气宇轩昂[qi4 yu3 xuan1 ang2]
promise of brilliant young person (idiom); showing extraordinary gifts
waist of a bear and back of a tiger/tough and stocky build
